Steve.Squeri@aexp.com

ä¸»ï¼š HK CEN Director oppressing the freedom of speech

Eleanor Roosevelt and the Universal Declaration of Human Rights —Article 19 states that "Everyone has the right to freedom of opinion and expression; this right includes freedom to freedom of absence and to seek, receive and impart information and ideas through any Media and regardless of frontiers".

On 16th Aug, a female staff in Hong Kong market, who had sent an email to thank her leaders for all their support during her 9 years tenure. She also stated that she had,donated $5K to the protestor funding, instead of a tradition farwell cake. However, the female staff received a notice at 6pm from her BYOD that someone had recalled the email. This is called oppressing the freedom of speech. I believe that no one should accept such "suppression behavior" occurred in a Global US company.
